ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: The event name for which the data was collected
Alcohol helps a person relax, feel happy, feel less tense, and can keep a person's mind off of mistakes at school or work.
Notes: 1 = Disagree Strongly; 2 = Disagree Somewhat; 3 = Uncertain; 4 = Agree Somewhat; 5 = Agree Strongly / tlfb_alc_l   == '1' ||  tlfb_alc_c_l   == '1'

ElementDescription: Alcohol can help how well a person gets along with others (makes people want to have fun together).
Notes: 1 = Disagree Strongly; 2 = Disagree Somewhat; 3 = Uncertain; 4 = Agree Somewhat; 5 = Agree Strongly / tlfb_alc_l   == '1' ||  tlfb_alc_c_l   == '1'

ElementDescription: Alcohol can hurt how well a person gets along with others (makes people mean to others).
Notes: 1 = Disagree Strongly; 2 = Disagree Somewhat; 3 = Uncertain; 4 = Agree Somewhat; 5 = Agree Strongly / tlfb_alc_l   == '1' ||  tlfb_alc_c_l   == '1'

ElementDescription: Alcohol helps people think better and helps coordination (people understand things better; can do things better).
Notes: 1 = Disagree Strongly; 2 = Disagree Somewhat; 3 = Uncertain; 4 = Agree Somewhat; 5 = Agree Strongly / tlfb_alc_l   == '1' ||  tlfb_alc_c_l   == '1'

ElementDescription: Alcohol hurts how people think and it hurts their coordination (run into things, act silly, have a hangover).
Notes: 1 = Disagree Strongly; 2 = Disagree Somewhat; 3 = Uncertain; 4 = Agree Somewhat; 5 = Agree Strongly / tlfb_alc_l   == '1' ||  tlfb_alc_c_l   == '1'

ElementDescription: Alcohol makes a person feel stronger and more powerful (easier to fight, speak in front of others, stand up to others).
Notes: 1 = Disagree Strongly; 2 = Disagree Somewhat; 3 = Uncertain; 4 = Agree Somewhat; 5 = Agree Strongly / tlfb_alc_l   == '1' ||  tlfb_alc_c_l   == '1'

ElementDescription: Alcohol can make people more careless or do things that could get them into trouble (do things they feel bad about; do things they regret).
Notes: 1 = Disagree Strongly; 2 = Disagree Somewhat; 3 = Uncertain; 4 = Agree Somewhat; 5 = Agree Strongly / tlfb_alc_l   == '1' ||  tlfb_alc_c_l   == '1'

ElementDescription: The first 5 times you ever drank: how many drinks did it take for you to begin to feel different? (where you could feel an effect) DO NOT count sips taken as a child.
The first 5 times you ever drank: How many drinks did it take for you to begin to feel a bit dizzy or to begin to slur your speech?
The first 5 times you ever drank: How many drinks did it take for you to begin stumbling, or walking in an uncoordinated manner?
The first 5 times you ever drank: How many drinks did it take you to pass out, or fall asleep when you did not want to?
Recent 6 months (Drinking at least once a month for 3 consecutive months): How many drinks did it take for you to begin to feel different? (where you could feel an effect)
Recent 6 months (Drinking at least once a month for 3 consecutive months): How many times did it take for you to begin to feel a bit dizzy or to begin to slur your speech?
Recent 6 months (Drinking at least once a month for 3 consecutive months): How many drinks did it take for you to begin stumbling, or walking in an uncoordinated manner?
Recent 6 months (Drinking at least once a month for 3 consecutive months): How many drinks did it take for you to pass out, or fall asleep when you did not want to?
Period of heaviest drinking: How many drinks did it take for you to begin to feel different? (where you could feel an effect)
Period of heaviest drinking: How many drinks did it take for you to begin to feel dizzy or to begin to slur your speech?
Period of heaviest drinking: How many drinks did it take for you to begin stumbling, or walking in an uncoordinated manner?
Period of heaviest drinking: How many drinks did it take for you to pass out, or to fall asleep when you did not want to?

ElementDescription: Please indicate how many times each has happened to you within the past 6 months while you were drinking or as a result of your alcohol use: not able to do your homework or study for a test.

Please indicate how many times each has happened to you within the past 6 months while you were drinking or as a result of your alcohol use: got into fights with other people (friends, relatives, strangers).

Please indicate how many times each has happened to you within the past 6 months while you were drinking or as a result of your alcohol use: missed out on other things because you spent too much money on alcohol.
Please indicate how many times each has happened to you within the past 6 months while you were drinking or as a result of your alcohol use: went to work or school high or drunk.
Please indicate how many times each has happened to you within the past 6 months while you were drinking or as a result of your alcohol use: caused shame or embarrassment to someone.
Please indicate how many times each has happened to you within the past 6 months while you were drinking or as a result of your alcohol use: neglected your responsibilities.
Please indicate how many times each has happened to you within the past 6 months while you were drinking or as a result of your alcohol use: friends or relatives avoided you.

Please indicate how many times each has happened to you within the past 6 months while you were drinking or as a result of your alcohol use: felt that you needed more alcohol than you used to in order to get the same effect.

Please indicate how many times each has happened to you within the past 6 months while you were drinking or as a result of your alcohol use: tried to control your drinking (tried to drink only at certain times of the day or in certain places, that is, tried to change your pattern of drinking).

Please indicate how many times each has happened to you within the past 6 months while you were drinking or as a result of your alcohol use: had withdrawal symptoms. That is, you felt sick because you stopped or cut down on drinking.
Please indicate how many times each has happened to you within the past 6 months while you were drinking or as a result of your alcohol use: noticed a change in your personality.
Please indicate how many times each has happened to you within the past 6 months while you were drinking or as a result of your alcohol use: felt that you had a problem with alcohol.
Please indicate how many times each has happened to you within the past 6 months while you were drinking or as a result of your alcohol use: missed a day (or part of a day) of school or work.

Please indicate how many times each has happened to you within the past 6 months while you were drinking or as a result of your alcohol use: suddenly found yourself in a place that you could not remember getting to.
Please indicate how many times each has happened to you within the past 6 months while you were drinking or as a result of your alcohol use: passed out or fainted suddenly.
Please indicate how many times each has happened to you within the past 6 months while you were drinking or as a result of your alcohol use: kept drinking when you promised yourself not to.
Please indicate how many times each has happened to you within the past 6 months while you were drinking or as a result of your alcohol use: felt physically or psychologically dependent on alcohol.

Please indicate how many times each has happened to you within the past 6 months while you were drinking or as a result of your alcohol use: was told by friend, neighbor or relative to stop or cut down drinking.
